channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building Materials, 23rd December
item.description:
Anonymous caller called report builders are pouring building materials down the gully drains and it's all over footway and along the road from No:16 - 48 Northcote Road. Please can we inspect has caller advised the drains have just been unblocked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Northcote Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage inadequate, 23rd December
item.description:
This drain reported as cleared in October. But everytime it rains water rushes down the hill bring debris with it and this drain fails. It’s not that it drains slowly. Days later and it’s still sitting there. This picture fron three days previous. It is still there now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Black bags on pavement at side of 186 Peckham Rye on The Gardens, 23rd December
item.description:
Black bin liner and other rubbish has been left on the pavement at the side of 186 Peckham Rye on The Gardens. There is further old ikea and flooring that has been dumped outside Dominic Court on the pavement. Please can this be removed? This is my second request. First request said there was nothing wrong but all the rubbish is still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44b, The Gardens, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serious potholes all along Perry Street, but in particular, the area nearest the BP garage, 23rd December
item.description:
Serious potholes all along Perry Street, but in particular, the area nearest the BP garage. REALLY dangerous for two wheelers filtering in the traffic as the road has serious splits along the centre. The street lighting is so bad, they're really hard to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serious potholes in the vicinity of the zebra crossing and towards the mini roundabout from Sidcup Hill, 23rd December
item.description:
Serious potholes in the vicinity of the zebra crossing and towards the mini roundabout from Sidcup Hill. Deep enough to be dangerous to two wheelers- and there are many operating out of the takeaway shops in the vicinity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter overflowing, 23rd December
item.description:
Greenwich council has unashamedly labelled my report from this morning as “resolved”. The issue is not resolved. There is litter everywhere and this is a systemic issue. You state it will be cleaned during the weekly scheduled clean. This does not happen. The litter accumulates week in week out. The clean supposedly happens on Wednesday - this hasn’t happened today at all. The overflowing bins have been left outside the adjacent flats all day and will just leave more rubbish everywhere. The council is categorically not on top of its waste management scheme and marks these systemic issues as “fixed” constantly,

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Banning Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madison Crescent, West Heath, Greater London
